meanings.definition: The sound made by a sheep or goat.
meanings.sent1: The bleating of the sheep could be heard across the field.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the gentle bleating of the goats outside.
meanings.sent3: The bleating of the sheep seemed to be their way of saying good morning.
meanings.sent4: The bleating of the goats filled the air like a chorus of tiny bells.
meanings.sent5: The constant bleating of the sheep created a peaceful background noise.

meanings.definition: To make the sound of a sheep or goat.
meanings.sent1: The sheep bleating in the meadow caught my attention.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the goats bleating as I approached the farm.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed bleating like sheep during the school play.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to be bleating through the trees on that stormy night.
meanings.sent5: Sheep bleating in the distance added a touch of nature to the landscape.

meanings.definition: Complaining or whining in a high-pitched voice.
meanings.sent1: The bleating child finally calmed down after getting a cookie.
meanings.sent2: She had a bleating tone as she complained about the long line.
meanings.sent3: The bleating customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent4: Her bleating voice echoed through the room, drawing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The bleating puppy was adorable despite its constant whining.
